column4: sda would be the first 'scsi' drive(usb and sata drives also show up as scsi)
also my ubuntu started to treat pata drives as scsi for a short while a few months ago(hda turned into sda)

by usually, I think he means the installer / boot process dynamically decides where to point that link. ls -l /dev/sr0 will show you where your one is pointing, because it will likely be a link to the 'real' device name
the symlink under /dev/ is made by udev(which has a flexible set of rules to addjust it)
